references.reason: This paper is foundational for the field of multi-view subspace clustering, providing a basis for many subsequent works, including the current paper.
This work addresses the practical challenge of incomplete data in multi-view clustering, a significant issue not fully resolved by earlier methods.

references.paper_title: Fast parameter-free multi-view subspace clustering with consensus anchor guidance
references.reason: This work improves on previous methods by providing a parameter-free approach that is both fast and effective for multi-view subspace clustering.
This method is efficient and simple while providing an effective solution to multi-view clustering and is used as a baseline in this current work.
This paper introduces the Shapley value, a crucial game theory concept adopted in the current paper for evaluating view contributions in multi-view clustering.
